communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

You kindly sent us copies of your records that show information as listed below dated to March 31 2024. Please will it be possible to have an update on any records that would show some or all of the following information:
1. A list of ALL hedge funds and fund of hedge funds in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and
2. For each hedge fund and fund of hedge funds, may I please have a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:
a. the month by month market value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in each fund from April 1 2024 to June 30 2024
b. the month by month amount invested by Richmond Retirement System in each fund from April 1 2024 to June 30 2024
c. the month by month net returns (net of fees) earned by Richmond Retirement System on its investment in each fund from April 1 2024 to June 30 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Haley Parker.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request

Thank you,

Kia Johnson
FOIA officer

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LACRIS Member List 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking a list or other documents naming the law enforcement agencies that can access the Los Angeles County Regional Identification System (LACRIS) and that can use the LACRIS facial recognition bio-metric database.  The LACRIS website indicates that there are 64 of these agencies.  

Please contract me if this request is unclear.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax

Thank you!

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

Thank you so much for your assistance, Renee. I was able to download the documents via the server instructions you provided. I look forward to your response on or before February 1st for the remaining documents.

Have a wonderful holiday season!

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Avondale, Az Police Dept.)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Avondale, Az Police Dept.)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ariel Van Cleve

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Mental Health Diversion Dept. 60
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all cases from January 1, 2019, through September 30, 2024,  in which The Honorable Judge Julianne Sylva denied a motion, petition, and/or application for mental health diversion, with a breakdown of each defendant's race, gender, ethnicity, and/or national origin.

As you may know, the California Public Records Act applies to all documents in the agency's possession, regardless of who authored them, and obliges you to respond to this request within 10 days if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question. In accordance with section 7922.000 of the California Public Records Act, if you claim that any portion of any record is exempt, please redact that portion of the record that you believe is exempt and provide both the statutory citation to any exemption you believe is applicable and the specific reasons for your conclusion that the redacted portion of the record is exempt from disclosure and produce the remainder of the record(s). If you claim that any of the requested records are not a public record, or you claim a privilege not to disclose any record, please respond by identifying any such records and explaining your claim that it is not a public record or why it is privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt, in accordance with section 7922.000. Please produce all records for which you do not claim an exemption or privilege. The California Public Records Act requires determination of whether these records may be disclosed, and specific reasons why any material requested, or portions thereof, are exempt from disclosure, within ten days from receipt of this request. See Cal. Gov’t Code section 7922.535. It also requires that you notify us of this determination and of the estimated date and time when the records will be produced. See id.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous Anon

title: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020
communications.communication:
LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

Via email: publicrecordsrequest@lwsd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2020 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2020.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2020 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Eastern High School walkout (Sept. 2024 request)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications to or from Superintendent Cloutier concerning the walkout at Eastern High School referenced in the April 22, 2024 letter from Camden County Commissioners Jeff Nash and Melinda Kane. These communications include (but are not limited to) any communications referencing the words "walkout," "walk out," "protest," "Israel," "Palestine," "Gaza," "anti-semitism," "anti-semitic," "antisemitism," "antisemitic," "Jews," or "Jewish." This request is limited to April 1, 2024 to May 15, 2024. This request satisfies N.J. Stat. § 47:1A-5(g)'s requirement that the request identify the specific job title, subject matter, and reasonable time period.

3. Any communications to or from the principal or vice principals referenced by Superintendent Cloutier’s statement which concern the walkout, any public or private response to the planned walkout, or the walkout’s cancellation. These communications include (but are not limited to) any communications referencing the words "walkout," "walk out," "protest," "Israel," "Palestine," "Gaza," "anti-semitism," "anti-semitic," "antisemitism," "antisemitic," "Jews," or "Jewish." This request is limited to April 1, 2024 to May 15, 2024. This request satisfies N.J. Stat. § 47:1A-5(g)'s requirement that the request identify the specific job title, subject matter, and reasonable time period.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Eastern High School walkout (Sept. 2024 request)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following New Jersey Open Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Sept. 6, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Eastern High School walkout (Sept. 2024 request)
communications.communication:
September 17, 2024

 

VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL

 

Adam Steinbaugh

 <mailto:172968-94498072@requests.muckrock.com> 172968-94498072@requests.muckrock.com

 

RE: September 6, 2024, Open Public Records Act (“OPRA”) Request (the “Request”)

 

Mr. Steinbaugh,

 

Please accept this letter is in response to the above-referenced request under the New Jersey Open and Public Records Act N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1 et. seq. (“OPRA”) which you sent via electronic mail on September 6, 2024, and was received by the Eastern Camden School District (“Board”) on September 9, 2024. The deadline to respond to your OPRA request is September 18, 2024. This response is being provided to you in a timely manner.

 

OPRA defines a “government record” of a public entity as “any paper, written or printed book, document, drawing, map, plan, photograph, microfilm, data processed or image processed document, information stored or maintained electronically or by sound-recording or in a similar device, or any copy thereof, that has been made, maintained or kept on file in the course of its official business …”. N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1.1. Accordingly, the Board is required to produce only those records which it maintains in the official course of business. Pursuant to the definition of a government record, a public entity is not required by OPRA to research information and/or create records that do not exist in response to OPRA requests. See e.g., Mag Entertainment, LLC v. Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control, 375 N.J. Super 537 (App. Div. March 2005). 

 

Your request and the Board’s response to the same is as follows:

 

REQUEST: Any communications to or from Superintendent Cloutier concerning the walkout at Eastern High School referenced in the April 22, 2024 letter from Camden County Commissioners Jeff Nash and Melinda Kane. These communications include (but are not limited to) any communications referencing the words "walkout," "walk out," "protest," "Israel," "Palestine," "Gaza," "anti-semitism," "anti-semitic," "antisemitism," "antisemitic," "Jews," or "Jewish." This request is limited to April 1, 2024 to May 15, 2024. This request satisfies N.J. Stat. § 47:1A-5(g)'s requirement that the request identify the specific job title, subject matter, and reasonable time period. Any communications to or from the principal or vice principals referenced by Superintendent Cloutier’s statement which concern the walkout, any public or private response to the planned walkout, or the walkout’s cancellation. These communications include (but are not limited to) any communications referencing the words "walkout," "walk out," "protest," "Israel," "Palestine," "Gaza," "anti-semitism," "anti-semitic," "antisemitism," "antisemitic," "Jews," or "Jewish." This request is limited to April 1, 2024 to May 15, 2024. This request satisfies N.J. Stat. § 47:1A-5(g)'s requirement that the request identify the specific job title, subject matter, and reasonable time period.

 

 

RESPONSE: The Board objects to and denies the request as it does not include the form components as set forth in subsection f. of section 6 of P.L.2001, c404 (C.47:1A-5). Specifically, the request does not include the required certification whether the government record will be used by that requestor or another person for a commercial purpose. Please note that the Board has adopted the new OPRA request form on its website https://www.eccrsd.us/. Please note that on June 5, 2024, Governor Murphy signed Bill 2930 into law which requires the request be submitted by the requestor in the form adopted by the custodian and the custodian may deny a request that is not submitted in a form adopted by the custodian. The law also notes that the form shall include space for a requestor to certify whether the government record will be used by that requestor or another person for a commercial purpose, and the requestor shall be required to provide this information for the request to be fulfilled. Specifically, commercial purpose means “the direct or indirect use of any part of government record for sale, resale, solicitation, rent or lease of a service, or any use by which the user expects to profit either through commission, salary, or fee.” Moreover, all requests by a data broker shall be denied. Data broker is defined as “a business that knowingly collects and sells to third parties the personal information of a consumer with whom the business does not have a direct relationship.” Sanctions may be imposed against individuals and entities that violate these rules. A requestor who is found to have sold the data obtained by a records request, who is found to have intentionally failed to certify the records request is for a commercial purpose, who is a data broker, or who was making the request on behalf of and for the use of a data broker, and if found to have intentionally certified that the requestor is not a data broker or is not making a request on behalf of and for the use of a data broker, shall be subject to a civil penalty of $1,000 for the first offense, $2,500 for the second offense, and $5000 for each subsequent offense. The penalties may be imposed by the courts.

 

If your request for access to a government record has been denied or unfilled within the seven (7) business days required by law, you have a right to challenge the decision by the District to deny access. At your option, you may either institute a proceeding in the Superior Court of New Jersey or file a complaint with the Government Records Council (GRC) by completing the Denial of Access Complaint Form.  You may contact the GRC by toll-free telephone at 866-850-0511, by mail at P.O. Box 819, Trenton, NJ 08625, or by e-mail at grc@dca.state.nj.us, or at their website at www.state.nj.us/grc. The GRC can also answer other questions about the law. All questions regarding complaints filed in Superior Court should be directed to the Court Clerk in your County.

 

Sincerely,

 

Ken Verrill, SBA

Business Administrator/Records Custodian

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Eastern High School walkout (Sept. 2024 request)
communications.communication:
Mr. Steinbaugh,



Please accept this e-mail in response to the above-referenced request under
the New Jersey Open and Public Records Act (“OPRA”). The deadline to
respond to your OPRA request is September 26, 2024. To that end, the Board
has identified a significant volume of potentially responsive records
related to your request. Given the scope and need for review, we will
require additional time to ensure we provide you with a complete and
accurate response. We are working diligently to process the records.
Currently, we anticipate needing a deadline of October 10, 2024, to
complete the review and deliver the requested information. Thank you for
your understanding.



Sincerely,


*Angela Shermer*
Administrative Assistant to the School Business Administrator, Mr. Ken
Verrill
Eastern Camden County Regional School District
Board of Education
1202 Laurel Oak Road, Suite 201
Voorhees, NJ 08043
ashermer@eccrsd.us
Office:  856-346-6730, ext. 2100

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  The contents of this email message and any
attachments are intended solely for the addressee(s) and may contain
confidential and/or privileged information and may be legally protected
from disclosure.  If you are not the intended recipient of this message or
their agent, or if this message has been addressed to you in error, please
immediately alert the sender by reply email and then delete this message
and any attachments.  If you are the intended recipient, you are hereby
notified that any use, dissemination, copying, or storage of this message
or it's attachments is strictly prohibited.

communications.subject: OPRA Response
communications.communication:
October 10, 2024

 

VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL

Adam Steinbaugh

 

172968-94498072@requests.muckrock.com
<mailto:172968-94498072@requests.muckrock.com> 

 

RE: September 17, 2024, Open Public Records Act (OPRA) Request (the
Request)

 

Mr. Steinbaugh,

 

Please accept this letter is in response to the above-referenced request
under the New Jersey Open and Public Records Act N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1 et. seq.
(OPRA) which you sent via electronic mail on September 17, 2024, and was
received by the Eastern Camden School District (Board) on September 18,
2024. On September 25, 2024, the Board advised you that we have identified
numerous documents responsive to your request and needed additional time to
review those documents, requesting a deadline of October 10, 2024, to
complete the review and deliver the requested information. This response is
being provided in a timely manner. 

 

OPRA defines a government record of a public entity as any paper, written
or printed book, document, drawing, map, plan, photograph, microfilm, data
processed or image processed document, information stored or maintained
electronically or by sound-recording or in a similar device, or any copy
thereof, that has been made, maintained or kept on file in the course of its
official business 
. N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1.1. Accordingly, the Board is required
to produce only those records which it maintains in the official course of
business. Pursuant to the definition of a government record, a public entity
is not required by OPRA to research information and/or create records that
do not exist in response to OPRA requests. See e.g., Mag Entertainment, LLC
v. Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control, 375 N.J. Super 537 (App. Div.
March 2005). 

 

Your requests and the agencys response to the same are as follows:

 

REQUEST: Any communications to or from Superintendent Cloutier concerning
the walkout at Eastern High School referenced in the April 22, 2024 letter
from Camden County Commissioners Jeff Nash and Melinda Kane. These
communications include (but are not limited to) any communications
referencing the words "walkout," "walk out," "protest," "Israel,"
"Palestine," "Gaza," "anti-semitism," "anti-semitic," "antisemitism,"
"antisemitic," "Jews," or "Jewish." This request is limited to April 1, 2024
to May 15, 2024. This request satisfies N.J. Stat. § 47:1A-5(g)'s
requirement that the request identify the specific job title, subject
matter, and reasonable time period. Any communications to or from the
principal or vice principals referenced by Superintendent Cloutiers
statement which concern the walkout, any public or private response to the
planned walkout, or the walkouts cancellation. These communications include
(but are not limited to) any communications referencing the words "walkout,"
"walk out," "protest," "Israel," "Palestine," "Gaza," "anti-semitism,"
"anti-semitic," "antisemitism," "antisemitic," "Jews," or "Jewish." This
request is limited to April 1, 2024 to May 15, 2024. This request satisfies
N.J. Stat. § 47:1A-5(g)'s requirement that the request identify the specific
job title, subject matter, and reasonable time period.

 

 

RESPONSE: The Board refers to the instant production, which includes
communications responsive to the above request. While the correspondence
requested consists of government records subject to disclosure under OPRA,
the agency has redacted the personal e-mail addresses of community members
to satisfy their duty to protect an individuals privacy interest. The link
to the requested documents is as follows:

 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LDjFhq1DXV8nWgKXTMXrFINcG1CdenA6/view?usp=s
haring

 

Once you have successfully downloaded the document, kindly advise so I can
delete the link. The link will stay active for 10 days.   

 

If your request for access to a government record has been denied or
unfilled within the seven (7) business days required by law, you have a
right to challenge the decision by the District to deny access. At your
option, you may either institute a proceeding in the Superior Court of New
Jersey or file a complaint with the Government Records Council (GRC) by
completing the Denial of Access Complaint Form.  You may contact the GRC by
toll-free telephone at 866-850-0511, by mail at P.O. Box 819, Trenton, NJ
08625, or by e-mail at grc@dca.state.nj.us, or at their website at
www.state.nj.us/grc. The GRC can also answer other questions about the law.
All questions regarding complaints filed in Superior Court should be
directed to the Court Clerk in your County.

 

Sincerely,

 

Ken Verrill

 

Business Administrator/Records Custodian

title: Support Programs for Baltimore City Youth and Squeegee Workers

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Support Programs for Baltimore City Youth and Squeegee Workers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to existing support programs or initiatives aimed at assisting young individuals, including squeegee workers, within the city of Baltimore. This includes information on educational opportunities, job training programs, and any other resources available to support their development and livelihoods.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made 
for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 days.

I am a student at Tulane University conducting research.

Sincerely,

Meghan Green
Mgreen16@tulane.edu

communications.subject: PIA request - BCDSS
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,
Yesterday, a staff person in my office forwarded me an electronic copy of a
PIA request you submitted via US Mail. See copy attached. In your letter,
you indicated you are "following up" on an identical request sent to us on
November 28, 2023. However, I regret to inform you that the BCDSS
Communications office never received that request.

Your request was mailed to:
City DSS Administration
PIA Office
Talmadge Branch
1910 N. Broadway
Baltimore, MD 21213

This is not our address. *Our correct mailing address is:*
Baltimore City Department of Social Services
c/o Communications Office
1910 N. Broadway
Baltimore, MD 21213

BCDSS/DHS does accept new PIA requests via mail, but we prefer that
requesters use our online portal. The online portal allows users to track
the status of their request and enables greater transparency and enhanced
communication with the department. Links to our portal can be found on our
website, www.dhs.maryland.gov. The direct link is:
https://marylanddhs.nextrequest.com/

I will manually log your request in our portal shortly, and you will
receive an auto-email confirmation once it's ready for inspection. Please
send any follow up communications via the portal. Given the delay you've
experienced, we will prioritize your request for processing.

Kind regards,
-Brian Schleter


-- 

[image: facebook.jpg] <https://www.facebook.com/BaltimoreDSS/>
<https://x.com/BaltimoreDSS> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/mdhumanserv>
<https://www.instagram.com/mdhumanservices/>

*Brian Schleter*

Deputy Director, Internal/External Affairs

1910 N. Broadway
Baltimore, MD 21213

dhs.maryland.gov/bcdss


(443) 378-4681 (office)

(443) 602-5218 (mobile)

<http://www.doit.state.md.us/selectsurvey/TakeSurvey.aspx?agencycode=DHR&SurveyID=86M2956>*

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding use of force.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katie Ryan

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Holland PD Use of Force Policy
communications.communication:
The Department of Public Safety - Police Division - FOIA/Records Department has received your email.  If this is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), a response will be sent to you pursuant to the timelines required under the FOIA and will be sent via the email you provided within five (5) business days.  Please be advised that requests received electronically are deemed received the following business day.

If you have any questions, please contact me.

Regards,

Nancy Gillis
Police Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Records Specialist
City of Holland
89 W. 8th Street, Holland, MI 49423
n.gillis@cityofholland.com<mailto:n.gillis@cityofholland.com> / 616-355-1103
Mon - Fri  7am-3pm
 Integrity | Respect | Professionalism | Dedication | Compassion

          "Safety, Prevention and Service through Community Partnerships and Law Enforcement"

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This electronic mail transmission contains Privileged and Confidential information intended only for the use of the addressee(s) named above.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination or copying of this transmission is strictly prohibited.  If you have received this transmission in error, please immediately notify the sender by telephone and return the original transmission to us at the above e-mail address.  Thank you.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Ryan Kelly arrest, employment records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Ryan Kelly arrest report, investigation

2. Village letters to Ryan Kelly regarding his employment status including but not limited to: putting him on administrative leave, changing his employment status, termination of employment

3. Last paycheck of Ryan Kelly

4. Last payment of health insurance for Ryan Kelly

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daelon

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Stradford Removal Exhibits
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All exhibits related to the May 20, 2024 hearing considering the removal of Brandon P. Stradford from his role as member of the state Board of Parole.

For DCJS's reference, DCJS Counsel and Deputy Commissioner Colleen M. Glavin verbally listed the exhibits at the beginning of the the May 20 hearing. Please see the following video recording, starting at timestamp 06:41: https://www.youtube.com/live/ReyToYvBPB8?feature=shared&t=401

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Stradford Removal Exhibits
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on August 9, 2024. The request was for "All exhibits related to the May 20, 2024 hearing considering the removal of Brandon P. Stradford from his role as member of the state Board of Parole."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Stradford Removal Exhibits
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for "All exhibits related to the May 20, 2024 hearing considering the removal of Brandon P. Stradford from his role as member of the state Board of Parole."

Please find attached two .pdf documents that are responsive to your request.   Please note that pursuant to Section 87(2)(b) of the Public Officers Law (POL), certain portions have been redacted for personal privacy.

Pursuant to POL §89(4)(a), you may appeal this determination within 30 days to the Counsel, Division of Criminal Justice Services, 80 South Swan St., Albany, NY 12210 or by email at foil@dcjs.ny.gov<mailto:foil@dcjs.ny.gov>.

Very truly yours,

Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Threat Index - Shinzo Abe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was seeking any records in your custody in relation to potential threats of assassination to the Former Japanese Prime Minster Shinzo Abe for the dates: 01/01/2022 to the current date.  

I was also seeking any records in your custody related to the Former Prime Minister based on the announcement of his untimely murder. 

 The former prime minister was assassinated on 070822 during a speech in NARA. 

 Areas to search:
All Available indices

EFOIA Request

Vaughn index is requested for any records claimed for exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes

Request for fee waiver: Category Media public interest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

communications.communication:
Dear Secret Service:

I was just following up on this request that was submitted via the national portal to you on 07/11/2022. The Muckrock.com website sent a notification that you responded to the request.  But your response is not published or viewable. Just wanted to confirm you sent a reply or if the site had a bug.  

Request shown below.



To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was seeking any records in your custody in relation to potential threats of assassination to the Former Japanese Prime Minster Shinzo Abe for the dates: 01/01/2022 to the current date.

I was also seeking any records in your custody related to the Former Prime Minister based on the announcement of his untimely murder.

The former prime minister was assassinated on 070822 during a speech in NARA.

Areas to search:
All Available indices

EFOIA Request

Vaughn index is requested for any records claimed for exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes

Request for fee waiver: Category Media public interest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

I wanted to send a reply to thank you for the attention to detail exhibited in your correspondence and the timeliness of your response to my emailed request. 

To allow for a proper public memorilization of this former Head of State, I am amciable to segregating the request into two requests if necessary to allow for protection of national security interests. 

Feel free to create a dialogue.

Professionally,

William Fernandes

communications.communication:
I find it troubling that our sovereignty as a nation is very dependent on our 'relations' including the financial support of our allies but is very easily subject to poor perception/reception due to internal misconduct. 

In bearing witness to this type of misconduct from 'civil servants' unemployed elsewhere pledged to serve humbly and faithfully engaging in mishandling of a sensitive request in an infamous disgraceful prejudicial fashion,  I feel assaulted. 
This conduct will only repel good energies and fortune and casts a permanent dinge that rings the upper echelons. 

Original Request:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

communications.subject: Thank you for your recent contact
communications.communication:
Thank you for taking the time to contact the Judiciary Committee’s Republican Oversight and Investigations staff.

We will contact you if further information is needed to inquire into the issues you have raised.

Although we cannot pursue every allegation that we receive, that does not mean your concerns may not have merit.  You should consider reporting waste, fraud, abuse, or mismanagement elsewhere as well, if you have not already done so.  Confidential, protected whistleblower disclosures can also be made to:

•         the Office of Special Counsel (https://osc.gov/pages/file-complaint.aspx)
•         the Office of the Inspector General for the Department of Justice (http://www.justice.gov/oig/hotline/), or
•         the office of inspector general at another relevant agency (https://www.ignet.gov/contact-us).

If you report your concerns to one of these agencies, please let us know so that we can ensure that the agency treats it appropriately.  Should you have additional information to provide, please do not hesitate to forward it to us at this email address.  All disclosures are treated as protected, and none of the information will be used without consulting with you first.  Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #20220564
communications.communication:
Freedom of Information Appeal
Deputy Director, U.S. Secret Service, 
Communications Center
245 Murray Lane, S.W., Building T-5, 
Washington, D.C. 20223.


Appeal for FOIA Numbers:
20220691
20220564

Grounds for appeal:
18 U.S.C. 798
18 U.S.C 1519
18 U.S.C 3056
18 U.S.C 1001
5 U.S.C. 552
18 U.S.C 2261a


I wanted to point out very plainly that anytime you tender correspondence to my offices be it to my email account or directly to the Muckrock.com website the correspondence is almost instantly shared with an estimated 5000+ major news networks and investigative journalists including CNN Digital, ProPublica, Vancouver Sun, WBTV News, Law&Crime, The Lawfare Institute, KMTV Omaha, NBC DFW, The Fresno Bee, and the Washington Post, among many others globally via www.documentcloud.org . 

In addition, activists and requesters have the authority to publish and distribute your responses to members of the Senate Judiciary as well as the Senate Intelligence Committee or the United Nations General Assembly or your OIG offices for that matter.  

A FOIA requester can be injured in 18 U.S.C. 2261a for the bare necessity of needing to communicate in relation to matters of fact discussed ‘inter alia’.   It can be considered a famine of the mind and a lack of candor under oath. 

Based on the public information available highlighting your duties as follows:

Protecting Leaders - United States Secret Service
https://www.secretservice.gov › protection › leaders

Temporary protectees -- such as presidential and vice presidential candidates or nominees and foreign heads of state -- are staffed with special agents on ..


Based on your organization maintaining records of Records of White House Secret Service Details , based on this single historic moment: 

Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's Visit to the United States of America
From April 26 to May 2,[2015] Prime Minister Abe visited the United States, which was the first official visit by a 
Prime Minister of Japan to the United States in nine years. The outline of the visit is as follows:

https://www.mofa.go.jp/na/na1/us/page3e_000341.html 

In addition, Prime Minister Abe was also reported widely in the news media for his support of USC.  

Former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe had unique connections to USC, Southern California

https://abc7.com/japanese-prime-minister-shinzo-abe-japan-us-relations-usc-japan/12032690/   

As related to foreign relations and the importance of such:
 

 
Saudi Arabia Warns of Economic Fallout if Congress Passes 9/11 Bill
WASHINGTON — Saudi Arabia has told the Obama administration and members of Congress that it will sell off hundreds of billions of dollars’ worth of American assets held by the kingdom if Congress passes a bill that would allow the Saudi government to be held responsible in American courts for any role in the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.
https://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/16/world/middleeast/saudi-arabia-warns-ofeconomic-fallout-if-congress-passes-9-11-bill.html  
And publicly available information in relation to the indices of records within the jurisdiction of 5 U.S.C 552 as shown: 
https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2001/08/28/01-21653/privacy-act-of-1974-as-amended-system-of-records  
It would appear your agency has intentionally took it upon themselves to engage in infamous, disgraceful conduct with intent to publish a falsehood about matters related to diplomatic security duties and records in existence which would fall within your agencies indices related to matters of historical significance.
The language of the request 20220564 was clearly spaced to require a production of both sentences as shown below and did not specify a range to search for records of the Prime Minister only a date range for a threat index. This FOIA was done in a polling fashion and FOIA Analysts of other agencies have not made the same error and if required, requested clarification.
Quoting the original request:
I was seeking any records in your custody in relation to potential threats of assassination to the Former Japanese Prime Minster Shinzo Abe for the dates: 01/01/2022 to the current date. 
I was also seeking any records in your custody related to the Former Prime Minister based on the announcement of his untimely murder. 
In the interest of intellectual discourse and brevity I refuse to further highlight the additional laws cited for appeal as this information is ‘inter-alia’.

Best,
/s/
William Fernandes

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana State Employees (2010 - 2019)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Louisiana Executive Branch from January 1, 2019 to the present. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within the offices of the Governor and Lieutenant Governor and all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2010 to December 31, 2019.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, job title, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, parish, hire date, termination date, civil service status, annual salary, and gross wages. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: 24-PRR-055  |  Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana State Employees (2010 - 2019)
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor:



Your February 13, 2024 public records request was received by the Division of Administration on February 14, 2024. We are conducting a search for records. Once the search is finished, the records will be reviewed for privileges and exemptions. We will contact you as soon as the review is completed, and all non-exempt, non-privileged, non-confidential records will be made available to you.

Thank you.

Public Records Requests
Division of Administration
State of Louisiana

Email: doapublicrecords@la.gov<mailto:doapublicrecords@la.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana State Employees (2010 - 2019)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Louisiana Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 14, 2024. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on March 21, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: 24-PRR-055  |  Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana State Employees (2010 - 2019)
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor:



Pursuant to your February 13, 2024 public records request, the Division of Administration is still searching for records and/or reviewing them for exemptions and privileges. Once we finish the search and review process, all non-exempt, non-privileged, non-confidential records will be made available to you. It is estimated the records will be available on or before April 19, 2024.

Thank you.

Public Records Requests
Division of Administration
State of Louisiana
Email: doapublicrecords@la.gov<mailto:doapublicrecords@la.gov>

communications.subject: RE: 24-PRR-055  |  Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana State Employees (2010 - 2019)
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor:

In response to your February 13, 2024 public records request, the Division of Administration has concluded its search for records. Please be aware of the following:


·        The information requested has been provided in quarterly reports. However, quarterly reports for the years 2020 – 2022 are not available.

  *   The information provided is for employees of executive branch agencies paid through the LaGov HCM payroll system. This does not include higher education or agencies in the legislative and judicial branches of government.
  *   The information reported is for employees active on the last day of each quarter.
  *   Gross wages and overtime are only provided for the fourth quarter of each year.
  *   Overtime spreadsheets include every employee who received overtime pay at any point during the respective calendar year.  Overtime reported is overtime that is paid as worked and it is included in the gross wages.  An explanation of the wage types can be found below.
  *   The agency hire date is optional for entry in the LaGov HCM payroll system and the use may vary by agency.  As such, this date may not exist for some employees.  We cannot confirm the accuracy of this date (if populated) and we cannot confirm it reflects the employee’s first date of state service.
  *   The Personnel Area Reference worksheet contains a mapping of agency number to agency name. The first three (3) characters in the name represent the department.
  *   The ZX01 worksheets contain columns for the racial categories.  This cell will reflect a value of “1” for the specified race.  An explanation of the column headings can be found below.
  *   Work addresses are not stored in the LaGov HCM system; work parish, if specified, is provided instead.

Explanation of overtime wage types:

  *   OT (ST) Attendance = Hour for hour overtime paid
  *   OT(1.5) Attendance = Straight rate overtime paid
  *   OT(1.5) Att - NE Prem = 0.5 rate piece of overtime paid which includes the FLSA calculation

Explanation of racial categories:

  *   Decl = Declined to State
  *   Ind/AK = American Indian or Alaskan Native
  *   Asian = Asian
  *   AfrAm = Black or African American
  *   HI/PI = Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

·        White = White

The below Dropbox link contains the records responsive to your request. You do not need a Dropbox account to view and download the documents. This link will expire after 30 days. Please note that any inadvertent production of records which are exempt from production under the Public Records Law does not constitute a waiver of this exemption.

https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/7bdajni7koucvspprcj1f/ABVEi3L4ANGxANaRo24Prkc?rlkey=emijmbhqyjeccrha3iartf7b1&st=5cbuu7ix&dl=0

The Division considers your request satisfied with this response. Accordingly, we are closing our file.

Thank you.

Public Records Requests
Division of Administration
State of Louisiana
Email: doapublicrecords@la.gov<mailto:doapublicrecords@la.gov>

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements (California State University Fullerton)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities, including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: FW: [External] California Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements (California State University Fullerton)
communications.communication:
Dear Muckrock:
We received your October 3, 2024 Public Records Act request for the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities, including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.
CSU has conducted a reasonable search for these records under California Government Code §7922.535 and has determined that your request, either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public records. CSU will make available to you any that are public. Please find the requested information attached.
Sincerely,

Anne Grogan, ARM (she/her)
Compliance Manager
Risk Management & Compliance
Human Resources, Diversity, and Inclusion
California State University, Fullerton
P: 657-278-5465

[Cal State Fullerton]

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: 4Sight Labs Medical Monitoring Bracelets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding the Kittitas County Jail's recent purchase of 4Sight Labs medical monitoring bracelets (https://komonews.com/news/local/kittitas-county-jail-first-in-washington-to-use-overwatch-health-monitoring-system-inmate-jail-protection-security-safety-solution-custody-kittitas-county-sheriffs-office-critical-pilot-program-technology-sensors), please provide:
1. All brochures, manuals, and other informational and/or promotional materials about 4Sight Labs and its products
2. All emails, text messages, and other communications with 4Sight Labs since 9/1/2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fkittitas-county-sheriff-23835%252F4sight-labs-medical-monitoring-bracelets-169385%252F%253Femail%253Dsheriff.office%252540co.kittitas.wa.us&url_auth_token=AADgsTvBHBnEomMjRuDv-k8V3Sg%3A1sUGKs%3AGL_DEK7tKIEDzz_Z95xaDcbdISdR6BLJ8Ub7J_YnkR0" A Public Records Officer of the Sheriff's Office will be helping you with your records request. An initial search and review of records matching your request will be completed and reply will be posted within five (5) business days.  This reply will either provide the requested records, ask you for clarification of your request, provide an estimate of fees, or, if your request is broad and involves a large number of records, you’ll be provided a schedule of response installments. Please note, the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request in the Kittitas County Public Records Portal. For your convenience, we are providing links to the legal authority which determines our response to public records requests: 
 
  *  Public Records Act, Chapter RCW 42.56 Kittitas County Codes Chapter 2.55 Thank you for your interest in public records. Sincerely, Sheriff's Office 
Kittitas County, WA

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse

Zip file "6th Installment - 10-9-24" containing 69 records 
Upon sending this email, the Sheriff's Office considers your public records request completed and closed. No further action will be taken on this request, and if you have any questions, I will do my best to answer, but your request will remain closed. Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to reply to this email or call our office at 509-962-7525. title: King County Directors Association -  Digital copies of all LEGAL INVOICES and/or PAYMENTS to Attorneys and/or Law Firms (2020-2024)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: King County Directors Association -  Digital copies of all LEGAL INVOICES and/or PAYMENTS to Attorneys and/or Law Firms (2020-2024)
communications.communication:
June 24, 2024

Public Records request for digital copies of all LEGAL INVOICES and/or PAYMENTS to Attorneys and/or Law Firms (2020-2024)

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request digital copies the following public records:

1. Digital copies of any/all invoices or bills for any/all legal services or legal representation provided to your AGENCY, your AGENCY BOARD OF DIRECTORS, and/or AGENCY employees or representatives.

2. Digital copies of any/all payments made by your AGENCY for any/all legal services provided to the AGENCY or AGENCY employees or AGENCY representatives.

3. Digital copies of any/all emails, texts, and/or communications of any kind regarding legal invoices and/or payment for legal services of any kind made by your AGENCY.

DATE RANGE

The date range for this request is January 1, 2020 to June 24, 2024.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION – REASONABLE ESTIMATE OF TIME

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

Please provide a “reasonable” estimate of time your agency intends to produce a first installment of records as per WAC 44-14-04003 (7) and RCW 42.56.520(1)(c). This time estimate should be an actual date such as May 31, 2024 rather than an undefined block of time in the future such as “within the next six months.” (Hikel v. City of Lynnwood, Dec. 27, 2016)

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf/ .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip or digital compression in each installment for the fewest number of total records and the most economical calculation of any applicable public records fees.

FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITAGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of
Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: King County Directors Association -  Digital copies of all LEGAL INVOICES and/or PAYMENTS to Attorneys and/or Law Firms (2020-2024)
communications.communication:
Attention Requester,



The purpose of this email is to acknowledge receipt of your Public Records Act request to King County Directors Association dated June 24, 2024, pursuant to RCW 42.56.520. KCDA's local public records policy can be found here: https://www.kcda.org/file%20library/public%20records%20policy%20and%20procedures/kcda_public_records_policy_and_procedures.pdf. KCDA estimates that all records responsive to your request will be made available to you no later than December 24th, 2029. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this time may be needed in order to locate and assemble documents responsive to your request; to notify third persons affected by the request; and to determine whether any of the information requested is exempt from public disclosure. KCDA will produce responsive, non-exempt records in installments. We estimate that the first installment will be produced no later than 90 days. You will be notified of any applicable charges prior to production of each installment.





Kindest regards,

Kristen Deskin, SHRM-SCP

Human Resources Manager

communications.communication:
Attention Requester,

We are following up on your request made on 6/24/2024.

The estimated fees associated with coping files for this request is $14. The estimated fees associated with scanning files for this request is $2. This is a total fee estimate for this public records request of $16.

A 10% deposit for the estimated charges is required before further work on this request commences. Please mail a check for at least $1.60 to KCDA, or schedule a time to come pay cash in person: 18639 80th Ave S. Kent WA, 98032 during regular business hours. You may choose to pay the estimate in full and any surplus payment of actual fees upon final delivery will be refunded. You also have the option to amend your request in order to avoid or reduce the cost of a customized service charge.

You have 30 calendar days to pay the deposit or amend this request. If you do not respond within 30 days, KCDA will believe that it has fulfilled your request by:

  *   Notifying you on 09/03/2024 that you needed pay a deposit or amend your request and you failing to do so.


Therefore, if the deposit is not paid nor the request amended, KCDA will officially close this request as of 10/04/2024 and will provide no further responses to this request. If you believe KCDA has closed this request in error, have questions, or need clarification concerning this request, please respond to this e-mail within 30 calendar days. The Public Records Acts gives the requestor one year from the date an agency closes a records request to file in court an allegation that the agency violated the Act. For this records request, that opportunity would expire one year from closure of the request on 10/04/2024 should no payment or amendment be provided.




Kindest regards,

Kristen Deskin, SHRM-SCP

Human Resources Manager

|Ph: 425-251-8115 x 126 | Fax: 253-395-5402 | Website: www.kcda.org<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__www.kcda.org&d=DwMFAg&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=nENpQzLk-uGrWkHwxoziCg&m=HlWXEFTpsQ9C8r1tPGamEHUN_2FRTwSPl3pnbFiYbZU&s=-LKuvaZQQYsP1g4-RvHIZjezWQUPhf1ftOeVvnj6V3M&e=>  |Follow us on LinkedIn<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.linkedin.com_company_kcda-2Dpurchasing&d=DwMFAg&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=nENpQzLk-uGrWkHwxoziCg&m=HlWXEFTpsQ9C8r1tPGamEHUN_2FRTwSPl3pnbFiYbZU&s=aYzv4vaom4CANgobAqjleLTbrg_Dy7AKsSKRlmuiQ-w&e=> and Facebook<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_KCDAPurchasingCoop_&d=DwMFAg&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=nENpQzLk-uGrWkHwxoziCg&m=HlWXEFTpsQ9C8r1tPGamEHUN_2FRTwSPl3pnbFiYbZU&s=OwHV1L24Ycg8CbKe8l8dryvoH2Wkcuwkd6TH6eCdbe4&e=>
